Name: Spanish Eyes
Ingredients: 5 ml Del Maguey Vida Clásico Mezcal
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest (discarded) & float star anise.
Review: Reminiscent of a Mexican Blood & Sand, refreshing and complex.
History: Created in August 2015 by yours truly (Simon Difford) at the Cabinet Room, London, England. Why Spanish eyes? Tequila distillers speak Spanish, Byrrh is made close to the Spanish boarder, pacharan is very Spanish, as are the best oranges. Plus my missus is half Spanish so has brown eyes and this drink is brownish.
Nutrition: One serving of Spanish Eyes contains 138 calories
